definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to demand the highest standards of sb (or oneself) (idiom)/to strive to achieve the best possible results/to be a perfectionist

sentences.english: His eagerness will not avail against the fitness and skill of his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 他求勝心切，但這並不能反抗得住對手的健壯與技藝。

sentences.english: Maybe she is just eager to see her grands children.
sentences.chinese: 也許她只是抱孫心切吧。

sentences.english: This handy gadgets peels an apple and also cuts out the core.
sentences.chinese: 這個方便的小器具可以削蘋果皮又把果心切出來。

sentences.english: Wash the cucumber, peeled and cut into thin slices to the heart.
sentences.chinese: 將胡瓜洗淨，去皮去心切成裂片。

sentences.english: But LinPingZhi revenge eager, but more than the sea escape live.
sentences.chinese: 但林平之報仇心切，卻被餘滄海擒住。

sentences.english: As the deer pants for the water, so my soul long after you.
sentences.chinese: 神啊，我的心切慕你，如鹿切慕溪水。

sentences.english: Their body language shows a willingness to fight on.
sentences.chinese: 他們的肢體語言顯示出他們求戰心切。

sentences.english: He sliced (into) his fingers by accident when cutting vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 他切菜時不小心切着了手指頭。

sentences.english: As the deer patheth for the water, so my soul longeth after Thee.
sentences.chinese: 神啊，我的心切慕禰，如鹿切慕溪水。

sentences.english: They have well-trained troops, who are spoiling for a fight.
sentences.chinese: 他們有一支訓練有素，求戰心切的部隊。

sentences.english: QinKun baby swiftly, forbid to wheat seek blade.
sentences.chinese: 秦坤愛女心切，不許麥子再去找刀鋒。

sentences.english: So fixated on exacting vengeance against Vader, Xizor's allowed his fortress to become infiltrated by Rebel Alliance agents.
sentences.chinese: 復仇心切的西佐允許義軍同盟偵察員潛入自己的城堡。

sentences.english: Maybe she is just eager to see her grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 也許她只是抱孫心切吧。

definition: with one's heart set on speeding home (idiom)
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to conceive a scheme/to devise a plan
human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural
